H3130.def: = man; ◄ eleventh son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► father of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>} and {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}, each founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H5401.def: = action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye

H3130.def: = man; ◄ eleventh son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and first son of {L:Rachel<SDBH:רָחֵל>}; ► father of {L:Ephraim<SDBH:אֶפְרַיִם>} and {L:Manasseh<SDBH:מְנַשֶּׁה>}, each founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H705.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6912.def: = to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

H6913.def: = place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H2945.def: = children dependent on their mothers for care{N:001}; ≈ in this sense usually occurring in a variant of the expression  טַף וְנָשִׁים "children and women", often with possessives, indicating their belonging to families headed by an adult male; ≈ associated with vulnerability and lack of strength

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H5800.def: = action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1657.def: = region; ◄ located in eastern {L:Egyptian<SDBH:מִצְרִי>} delta; ► where {L:Israelites<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} lived from the time they settled in the country until the exodus

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3515.def: = state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H4264.def: = open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1637.def: = level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze

H329.def: = a tree that grows to 5 meters (17 feet), has small leaves forming an oval crown, and very sharp thorns; Lycaeum europaeum ({A:HALOT}, {A:DCH}, {A:NIDB} 1:496); or possibly a thorny bush of the Rubus genus, which includes several hundred species ({A:ABD} 2:80)

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3383.def: = river; ◄ flowing from Mount {L:Hermon<SDBH:חֶרְמֹון>} in a southerly direction through the {L:Sea of Galilee<SDBH:כִּנֶּרֶת>} into the {L:Dead Sea<SDBH:יָם־הַמֶּלַח>}

H5594.def: = action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H4553.def: = mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H60.def: = a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
